intro: Rochelia marginata, commonly known as the marginate rochelia, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Aizoaceae. It is native to southern Africa, particularly South Africa, where it thrives in arid and semi-arid environments. The plant is characterized by its fleshy, succulent leaves and vibrant, star-shaped flowers that bloom in shades of yellow and orange. It produces small, capsule-like fruits that contain numerous seeds. Rochelia marginata is often cultivated as an ornamental plant due to its unique appearance and drought tolerance.
